Articles.Content:
<p>We interrupt your regularly scheduled <strong>Modding Mondays</strong> post to bring you some top notch, independently-made videos about <strong><em>Kerbal Space Program: Asteroid Redirect Mission</em></strong>! Keep your eyes here and our other community channels for more info on release dates and more.</p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/5ZFQm4VQYKQ" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/NBSQ7UQkFZw" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/X7-l6Y9obdc" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/cOGV1FSvtwA" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/v_1wJ6MLhfg" width="420"></iframe></p>
It's happening! !!!!!!!!!!!

In addition to the asteroid content, I like all the other little tweaks I'm seeing.

And, custom colors for the Illuminators? Sweet!

I watched the second video and started clapping at you guys.

Those maneuvers tweaks and MET/UT time were really needed in the game.

I'm really looking forward to play this update

Curse you nsa for making these videos buffer while i'm watching

also can't wait for this awesome pack!!!!!!!

Edit: i cannot wait! I WANTS IT! I WILL SACRIFICE WHATEVER ANIMAL/PERSON TO GET THIS UPDATE NOW! But please take your time

Edited March 25, 2014 by Helix935
saw all videos
Quicksave anytime! YAY!
Much excite! hopefully it drops prior to this weekend!

Is it out yet? (checks Steam) How about now? (checks Steam) Now? (checks Steam) Maybe now? (checks Steam) Ok, I can wait. (checks Steam) No I'm not addicted. (checks Steam) Now? (checks Steam)........

Seriously though, I just built a new computer that runs it great, and now I don't want to continue with my current mission. (This is NOT a complaint, but a compliment) I am very much excited to start a new save, as my hardware is more capable now, this is like getting a birthday present (March 23, turned 55) from Squad for my new computer! (checks Steam)

....

Edited March 25, 2014 by pslytely psycho
(checks Steam)
I'd be more than happy to sacrifice a modding monday for this.

Nice, very nice, a lot of good stuff, we can forecast a lot of "wasted procrastination time" with this update.

And with the lights custom colours my daughters will have their pink station ! (yay \o/ pink everywhere !).

But I'm a bit concerned about the big pink rocket with two darker pink round boosters on the side. Is it Austin Power all over again ?

Looking good!

I like the interview video from Scott Manley.

Quicksave anytime! YAY!

Wait... what?

A couple of mistakes in the second video:

The new large 3m engine is not good for upper stages, having a lower vacuum ISP than sea level ISP.

The Ion engine is not more efficient in space - in fact, its ISP got slashed in half.

The Rockomax 24-77 was not tweaked.

Ok, maybe I'm nitpicking too much.

I like the interview video from Scott Manley.

Me too, it was just the nerdy developer talk I'm always looking for.
Not getting spoiled about ARM is getting harder every day. Hope it will come out soon!
Scott Manley's video is great. Those under-the-hood tech-info-bits are exactly the kind of thing I've been missing lately.

Arrrrrrrrrghhhhh I'm on lunch break and have'nt got time to watch all the vids

Boris

EEEkkk the Boss (hides)
Already all seen, you're outdated
In Scott Manleys video did you notice all the shuttle models behind Chad, is this related to any further future developments?

A couple of mistakes in the second video:

The new large 3m engine is not good for upper stages, having a lower vacuum ISP than sea level ISP.

The Ion engine is not more efficient in space - in fact, its ISP got slashed in half.

The Rockomax 24-77 was not tweaked.

Ok, maybe I'm nitpicking too much.

Felipe from the Manley's interview said that the 3m single engine is good for upper stage so maybe there's just an error in compilation of .cfg file

In Scott Manleys video did you notice all the shuttle models behind Chad, is this related to any further future developments?

Perhaps they were just exchanging gifts with the NASA guys.

I'd be more than happy to sacrifice a modding monday for this.

http://www.laparabolica.es/wp-content/uploads/Happy_gif.gif

WAIT... Spoilers were fixed??? This is the greatest update to the forum

MUCH TEXT.

A couple of mistakes in the second video: The Ion engine is not more efficient in space - in fact, its ISP got slashed in half.

What? Ion is for atmo flight now? *scratches head*

Alright Squad! Refine and improving the game is ALWAYS a good idea!

I am really happy with those new engines and fuel tanks. We have a new standard for heavy lifting ability of rockets and SSTOs!

PS: Thank GOODNESS they nerfed the ion engine, that thing was ridiculous. U could even build a MANNED ssto that ran on ion engine and take it anywhere in Kerbal system.

But you know what scares me, in the back of my mind.. NASA promoted this add on. Why? Are they trying to come up with a solution using the Kerbal community for some rock out there that WILL hit us sometime in the future?? I'm just saying... of all things... why asteroids?

But you know what scares me, in the back of my mind.. NASA promoted this add on. Why? Are they trying to come up with a solution using the Kerbal community for some rock out there that WILL hit us sometime in the future?? I'm just saying... of all things... why asteroids?

Because asteroid threats are sensational scary things? Same reason Michael Bay made a movie about one.
